DataElement.preferredName: Metaphase Clinical Study Specimen Culture Procedure Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field used to capture the period of time during which laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms is obtained for testing, examination or study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Metaphase Clinical Study Specimen Culture Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to a laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms and the arrangement of chromosomes in the equatorial plane of the central spindle to form the monaster.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Arrangement of chromosomes in the equatorial plane of the central spindle to form the monaster.  Chromosomes separate into exactly similar halves. (NCI):Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research.

Concepts.definition: The second phase of mitosis, in which the chromosomes line up across the equatorial plane of the spindle prior to separation.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/22/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. Modified for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg (JP) 12/2010.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
